nodes.bodyText: Is it ok to create many of those during initialization if there are concurrent calls?
Is it an invariant that account id is always set in the load balancer id?
Looks like we are using string representation arn.toString() returned by this function. Do we need to build Arn object or would we rather build a string and return just that?

👍 probably not a huge deal, it might just increase the number of thread (pools) and connections during initialization a bit, but I agree it would be probably better to do a simple double-checked lock of the whole thing here and serialize calls
How do we make sure the credentials provider in the Map is still valid and has not expired the session duration when first constructed?

commit.message: add double checked log to providers

nodes.bodyText: minor: sinchronize on an instance level mutex just to avoid issues when this class is not being used as a singleton (e.g.: tests)
